content.description: Climb 15 feet of hand/fist sized crack.
content.location: Between several boulders on the East side of the cluster.

content.description: Just downhill from Classic Overhang, but somewhat difficult to locate. SDS at jugs, make easy moves directly up to a huge deadpoint to a sloper.
Climb the slab up the middle.  Micro crimps, good feet needed.  Commit at top to some slopey holds  and then back to a jug on the right.
content.location: North slab face of big Cluster boulder, in the middle just to the right of the tree.

content.description: Stand start on the lowest credit card crimps to the right of Mike's Slab. Climb up and right to better edges, then to great edges the next move up. Interesting hand-foot matches on the good edges lead upwards to a slightly heady but fun finish. Starting on the higher crimps makes the climb V3.
content.location: Starts just to the right of Mike's Slab. Look just right of the tree closest to the boulder.

content.description: Climb blunt arete.  Second move after start is the crux to get up on the arete.
content.location: North side of big slabby Cluster boulder, far left arete to the right of the offwidth crack.

content.description:
Sit-start on sloping jugs, under the low roof, on the side boulder. Climb the short arÃªte

.
content.location: The Top Rope Boulder is in the middle of the lower cluster area on the west boulders. It would be adjacent to the French Maid boulder and in-between the classic overhang. if you are at the classic overhang. Walk towards the French maid down the hill and you will see a tall boulder on the right. The smaller boulder on the left that is sloping to the left. This is where your start is for circus tricks.
